summary: equine arteritis virus (EAV), lactate dehydrogenase-elevating virus (LDV) and porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus (PRRSV) are spherical to pleomorphic. in Asian macaques, SHFV causes a viral hemorrhagic fever that is nearly 100% lethal (6, 7) these subgenomic mRNAs encode at least eight structural proteins that are essential for virion infectivity. they appear to have functional analogs in particles of other arteriviruses (E, GP2 to -5, GP5a, M, and N) the molecular aspects of the SHFV life cycle have been understudied. two cell surface factors have been implicated as receptors for PRRSV. PRRSV GP2 and GP4 interact with CD163 (25) clathrin-mediated endocytosis seems to be the predominant route of cell entry. confluent MA-104 cells were exposed to p2 viruses at a multiplicity of infection (MOI) of 0.01 and observed until the virus-induced cytopathic effect affected 70 to 80% of the culture. the cells were lysed by two cycles of freeze-thawing, and the medium was clarified of debris by centrifugation. MERS-CoV propagated on vero E6 cells at an MOI of 0.01, as previously described. the cell media were removed, and the cells were washed once with EMEM without FBS. the cells were then incubated at 37°C for 48 h and stained with 5% neutral red. cells were infected with VACV-eGFP at an MOI of 1. cells were washed two times with phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) at 6 h postinoculation, cells were detached using trypsin. confluent MA-104 cells were exposed to SHFV particles at an MOI of 50 for 1 h at 4°C to permit virion adsorption to cell surfaces. the cells were scraped off 10 min later with a cell scraper, collected into 15-ml tubes, and immediately centrifuged at 500 g for 20 min. the embedded blocks were sectioned using a Leica EM UC7 ultramicrotome (Leica Microsystems, Buffalo Grove, ammonium chloride (NH4Cl), blebbistatin, chloroquine, CA-074, chlorpromazine, -chymotrypsin, concanamycin A, cytochalasin D, dynasore, E-64d, 5-(N-ethyl-N-isopropyl) amiloride (EIPA), filipin III, FYdmk. -cyclodextrin, phospholipase A2, phospholipase D, trypsin, proteinase K, papain, and -chymotrypsin were added to inhibitor-containing media. the cells were then exposed to SHFV for 1 h at an MOI of 5 for 1 h. MA-104 cells were transfected with plasmids using lipofectamine 3000. sorted cells using a BD FACS Aria II cell sorter. clathrin heavy chain knockout experiments were performed. gRNA-85, gRNA1 and after blocking in 5% nonfat milk powder in PBS with 0.1% Tween (Sigma-Aldrich), the membranes were incubated overnight. ton X-100 (Sigma-Aldrich) cells were stained with Alexa 594-phalloidin (Life Technologies) for 20 min at room temperature and again washed twice with PBS, mounted, and viewed. the cells were infected with SHFV or PRRSV at an MOI of 5 at 37°C for 1 h. cubated MA-104 cells with SHFV particles at an MOI of 0.1, 1 or 5 for 1 h at 37°C; removed the inocula; and incubated the cells for 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, or 72 h in fresh medium. for all MOIs, viral titers increased more than 10- to 100-fold over baseline at 8 h, with viral production peaking at 48 to 60 h. concanamycin A, a specific inhibitor of vacuolar-type H+-ATPases, reduced SHFV particle production by roughly 5,000-fold at a concentration of only 20 nM. together, these observations indicate that SHFV uses a pH-dependent and, therefore, most likely an endosomal cell entry pathway. endocytic pathways are used by viruses, including dynamin-mediated (usually clathrin-mediated) endocytosis, clathrin-independent endocytosis, macropinocytosis, and caveola-mediated endocytosis (35). PRRSV and EAV both enter cells via CME, and our transmission electron microscopy data suggest that SHFV may utilize a similar mechanism. clathrin HC expression in MA-104 cells treated with clathrin CD163 plays an important role in SHFV cell entry. the error bars indicate the standard deviation of triplicate samples. viral titers increased more than 10- to 100-fold over baseline at 8 h. viral production peaked at 48 to 60 h. cDNA clones of SHFV are yet to be established. concanamycin A, a specific inhibitor of vacuolar-type H+-ATPases, reduced SHFV particle production by roughly 5,000-fold at a concentration of only 20 nM. together, these observations indicate that SHFV uses a pH-dependent and, therefore, most likely an endosomal cell entry pathway. prior to SHFV infection, we treated MA-104 cells with increasing concentrations of chemicals known to inhibit CME. phenylarsine oxide inhibited CME at concentrations of 1 to 20 M by interfering with the production of phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate needed for CME. the error bars indicate the standard deviations of triplicate samples. blebbistatin lowers the affinity of myosin II for actin. wortmannin is a covalent inhibitor of phosphatidylinositide 3-kinases. none of the three compounds had an effect on SHFV particle production. experiments with the dynamin inhibitors dynasore and Dyngo-4a, as well as with a dominant-negative dynamin mutant, suggest that SHFV utilizes a dynamin-mediated pathway. pretreated with bona fide CME inhibitors became resistant to SHFV particle entry. clathrin heavy chain knockout also inhibited virus infection. only one cell line, MA-104 (and its subclones) is known to be susceptible to SHFV. three inhibitors may have some effect on SHFV infection. however, the macropinocytotic pathway is highly unlikely to be a major gateway for SHFV into MA-104 cells. tilin, and ARF6 pathways were not
